intro: Hieracium rauzense var. ratezaticum, commonly known as the Ratzatich hieracium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Hieracium. Native to the Balkan region, this variant thrives in moist, calcareous soils in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine pubescence. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Hieracium genus, valued for its ornamental and ecological roles.
